pull.title: Add peertablesortproxy module
pull.body:
The "Peers" table in the "Node" window does not hold multiple selection after sorting.

This PR introduces a `QSortFilterProxyModel` subclass, that is a standard Qt [practice](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/model-view-programming.html#custom-sorting-models) for such cases.

Now the sorting code is encapsulated into the dedicated Qt class, and we do not need to maintain it.

Fixes #283 (additionally).

---

On **master** (7ae86b3c6845873ca96650fc69beb4ae5285c801):
- rows are sorted by "Ping", and a selection is made
![Screenshot from 2020-11-28 22-53-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/100525900-96eaed00-31cc-11eb-86e7-72ede3b8b33c.png)

- rows are sorted by "NodeId", and the previous selection is _lost_
![Screenshot from 2020-11-28 22-53-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/100525904-9c483780-31cc-11eb-957c-06f53d7d31ab.png)

With **this PR**:
- rows are sorted by "Ping", and a selection is made
![Screenshot from 2020-11-28 22-39-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/100525776-06aca800-31cc-11eb-8c4e-9c6566fe80fe.png)

- rows are sorted by "NodeId", and the row are still selected
![Screenshot from 2020-11-28 22-39-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/100525791-2348e000-31cc-11eb-8b78-716a5551d7ec.png)

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.body: Is this a refactor or feature or bugfix?

> Is this a refactor or feature or bugfix?

A bugfix, I think.

The correct handling of multiple selections during sorting by a column could be observed in the transaction table.

No sure if this is worth the effort.
No strong opinion though.
Please rebase If this should be dragged along.

> Please rebase If this should be dragged along.

Rebased 0a03c82cefab82e273c5e76a3a3b93ae6a75df54 -> b119ae0c82c6f36afdf3eefd89b687ab78a9e34a ([pr18.01](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.01) -> [pr18.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.02)).

Tested ACK b119ae0 on Arch Linux and macOS 10.15.7. Code looks good and PR does what it says it will do. 

The behavior this PR introduces of showing nothing is a better behavior than the default functionality. I think an even better behavior would be to, as you select a group of peers, show the last peer that you selected in that selection group.

> @jarolrod
> 
> > The behavior this PR introduces of showing nothing is a better behavior than the default functionality.
> 
> Do you mean #13?

Oh yes, sorry. Overlooked that this builds upon that PR.

Rebased b119ae0c82c6f36afdf3eefd89b687ab78a9e34a -> ab070cf39a6756723a4efc17e6e98de9d47425d5 ([pr18.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.02) -> [pr18.03](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.03)) due to the conflict #13.
The OP updated with screenshots.

Rebased ab070cf39a6756723a4efc17e6e98de9d47425d5 -> 5745711a8b2641fe727b98fa93425f4b0f4e4beb ([pr18.03](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.03) -> [pr18.04](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.04)) on top of the recent changes in p2p logic and CI.

~Converting to draft as a bug was discovered while testing in the light of #158.~

That bug is not related to changes in this PR.

Updated 6f1ccc74b260413ad6750a693e8e0bdc36881300 -> 6c273034da293f6d4ac691959c5c6435f67200be ([pr18.05](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.05) -> [pr18.06](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.06)):
- fixed a bug with the detailed widget update
- rebased on top of #161

Please review #161 first :)

@jonasschnelli 
> No sure if this is worth the effort.

Benefits:
- less lines of code (+109 / -175)
- using a proper abstraction layer for sorting makes the code more readable and maintainable
- using a proper abstraction layer _fixes_ a buggy behavior when sorting is applied while multiple rows are selected

Also this PR is required for #164 bugfix.

Rebased 6c273034da293f6d4ac691959c5c6435f67200be -> 9bc2004db26a3a956256f8fd9b05e7a3e9e21aca ([pr18.06](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.06) -> [pr18.07](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.07)) due to the conflict with #162.

Rebased 9bc2004db26a3a956256f8fd9b05e7a3e9e21aca -> fb6901787d7eafec5bc17d5f0c271935ac1e1c17 ([pr18.07](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.07) -> [pr18.08](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.08)) due to the conflict with #161.

re-ack fb6901787d7eafec5bc17d5f0c271935ac1e1c17, tested on macOS 11.1 with Qt 5.15.2 @jonasschnelli in regards to [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/18#issuecomment-715217620): If I wanted to see how certain peers rank based on different metrics, it would be nice to have the peers I have in interest remain selected as I change the sorting. So, this PR does add value. Below are screenshots showing the behavior between `master` and this `PR` ### Master **Master:** Select three peers with default sorting (by Peer ID) **Master:** Change to sorting by Ping -> peers of interest are no longer selected ### PR **PR:** Select three peers with default sorting (by Peer ID) **PR:** Change to sorting by Ping -> Peers remain selected

Rebased fb6901787d7eafec5bc17d5f0c271935ac1e1c17 -> 4a032f64e45c7d78a378057e878acc0b101467a6 ([pr18.08](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.08) -> [pr18.09](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.09)) due to the conflict with #180.

Rebased 4a032f64e45c7d78a378057e878acc0b101467a6 -> 8d4a682791bedcc9cf471e9d77e77ec46d0bc314 ([pr18.09](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.09) -> [pr18.10](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.10)) due to the conflict with #179.
re-ACK 8d4a682791bedcc9cf471e9d77e77ec46d0bc314, tested on macOS 11.1 Qt 5.15.2 after rebase
Concept ACK, haven't reviewed the code in detail but conceptually this is the proper Qt way of doing this.

Rebased 8d4a682791bedcc9cf471e9d77e77ec46d0bc314 -> 56e5f5aefce6df0e54fbbd556d7bcdca3f167d12 ([pr18.10](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.10) -> [pr18.11](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.11)) due to the conflict with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21015.

events.body: Rebased 56e5f5aefce6df0e54fbbd556d7bcdca3f167d12 -> 5a4a15d2b4456272fd8aa080195f40a09576ae01 ([pr18.11](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.11) -> [pr18.12](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr18.12)) due to the conflict with #166.
re-ACK 5a4a15d2b4456272fd8aa080195f40a09576ae01, tested on macOS 11.2 Qt 5.15.2 after rebase
seems like a fair bit of code for functionality which I'd expect by default.... nice work though.

Concept ACK, I think this is the best approach to keep a model sorted and eventually filtered.

~~Should `setDynamicSortFilter(true)`?~~ nevermind, it's true by default.

Tested ACK 5a4a15d2b4456272fd8aa080195f40a09576ae01.

#283 is fixed, selected cell is copied with copy shortcut.

comments.body:
778a64af209e4fa692a3aca8376ba1bd5e1af881

I don't think this belongs here, should be a member of `RPCConsole` - usually, sort/filter models are instanced for each view unless you want to share the same sorting/filter result in multiple views (I know it's only used in `RPCConsole`).

From the `##bitcoin-core-gui` IRC channel:
> \<promag> https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/18 seems ready
> \<promag> https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/18#discussion_r616065705 can be addressed later
